oligo_synthesis Package¶

gene_splitter Module¶

class pymbt.oligo_synthesis.gene_splitter.GeneSplitter(seq, **kwargs)[source]¶

Split a large (~<10kb) sequence into smaller ones that are easier to clone, either via oligo assembly or PCR. Store and write the results.

Parameters:
  • seq (str.) – Input sequence.
  • **kwargs –

    Keyword arguments to pass to split_gene.
write(path)[source]¶
pymbt.oligo_synthesis.gene_splitter.find_best(walked, max_len, seq_len, force_exhaustive=False)[source]¶

Search for the optimal overlap combination.

Parameters:walked – list of lists of the output to context_walk, representing

a collection of each potential overlap’s evaluated windows. :type walked: list. :param max_len: Maximum length of each split-up output sequence. :type max_len: int. :param force_exhaustive: Forces algorithm to find global optimum exhaustively. Can dramatically slow down the computation. :type force_exhaustive: bool.

pymbt.oligo_synthesis.gene_splitter.remove_from_left(pre_combo_list, max_len)[source]¶

Traverse list of lists of (start, end, score) tuples of the type returned by context_walk. Removes any entries that cannot bridge the gap to the next set of overlaps (distance greater than max_distance). This greatly speeds up computation time by removing impossible combinations before they are evaluated computationally.

Parameters:pre_combo_list – list of lists of the output to context_walk,

representing a collection of each potential overlap’s evaluated windows. :type pre_combo_list: list. :param max_len: Maximum length of each split-up output sequence. :type max_len: int.

pymbt.oligo_synthesis.gene_splitter.remove_from_right(pre_combo_list, max_len)[source]¶

Does the same thing as remove_from_left but in the reverse direction. These two functions have to be paired repeatedly in order to fully trim the sequence (remove_nonspanning will do this)

Parameters:pre_combo_list – list of lists of the output to context_walk,

representing a collection of each potential overlap’s evaluated windows. :type pre_combo_list: list. :param max_len: Maximum length of each split-up output sequence. :type max_len: int.

pymbt.oligo_synthesis.gene_splitter.remove_nonspanning(pre_combo_list, max_len)[source]¶

Trims list of lists of (start, end, score) tuples to those that actually have a chance of spanning the sequence

Parameters:pre_combo_list – list of lists of the output to context_walk,

representing a collection of each potential overlap’s evaluated windows. :type pre_combo_list: list. :param max_len: Maximum length of each split-up output sequence. :type max_len: int.

pymbt.oligo_synthesis.gene_splitter.split_gene(seq, max_len=1100, min_context=200, core=60, context=90, step=10, force_exhaustive=False)[source]¶

Split a large (~<10kb) sequence into smaller ones that are easier to clone, either via oligo assembly or PCR.

Parameters:
  • max_len (int.) – Maximum length of each split-up output sequence.
  • min_context – Sets minimum size of each potential overlap

region to evaluate. :type min_context: int. :param core: Window size. :type core: int. :param context: Amount (in bp) of context to evaluate on either side of the window. :type context: int. :param step: Step size for the windows. :type step: int. :param force_exhaustive: Forces algorithm to find global optimum exhaustively. Can dramatically slow down the computation. :type force_exhaustive: bool.

oligo_assembly Module¶

Module supplying methods/classes for generating overlapping oligo sequences from a gene sequence.

class pymbt.oligo_synthesis.oligo_assembly.OligoAssembly(seq, primers=False, primer_tm=60, **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: object

Split a sequence into overlapping oligonucleotides with equal-Tm overlaps. Contains results and output methods.

Parameters:
  • seq (str.) – Input sequence (DNA).
  • primers – Design cloning primers that bind the termini of the

input sequence. :type primers: bool. :param primer_tm: Ideal Tm for the cloning primers, if applicable. :type primer_tm: float. :param **kwargs: Keyword arguments to pass to oligo_calc.

write(outpath)[source]¶

Write results out to a csv (comma-separated) file.

Parameters:outpath (str.) – path to csv file, including .csv extension.
pymbt.oligo_synthesis.oligo_assembly.oligo_calc(seq, tm=72, oligo_size=120, require_even=True, start_5=True)[source]¶

Split a sequence into overlapping oligonucleotides with equal-Tm overlaps.

Parameters:
  • seq (str.) – Input sequence (DNA).
  • tm (float.) – Ideal Tm of the overlaps, in degrees C.
  • oligo_size (int.) – Maximum oligo size (e.g. price-point jump size).
  • require_even (bool.) – Require that the number of oligonucleotides is even.
  • start_5 (bool.) – Require that the first oligo’s terminal side is 5’.

structure_windows Module¶

pymbt.oligo_synthesis.structure_windows.context_walk(seq, core_len, context_len, step)[source]¶

Generate context-dependent ‘non-boundedness’ series of scores for a given DNA sequence. Uses NUPACK’s pair probabilities to derive the score.

Parameters:
  • seq (str.) – Input sequence.
  • core_len (int.) – Window size in base pairs.
  • context_len – The number of bases of context to use when analyzing

each window. :type context_len: int. :param step: The number of base pairs to move for each new window. :type step: int.
